text: Bottle pour thanks to like pours amber brown with no head. Used wet wipes, caramel. Diaper. Medium sourness, light body. Average carbonation

Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. Bottled APRIL2015. Colour is murky reddish light brown with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Berries, red berries, sourness, wood and dryness. Some vineous elements. Nice dry wood in palate.
Apricot and sour plum. Pours dark brown with good head and lacing. Tamyy finish. A little lime peel. Gopd balance and well done like you would expect. 2012 Bottle.

13/04/2017 - 33cl bottle @ Gainsbar, Kortrijk.
Brown red colour with a small tanned lacing.
Nose is sour, oak, fruity. Taste is malts, chocolate, sour, sweet touch, red fruits, oak. Incredible taste but but little to no aftertaste.

Rami Rami is drinking an Oerbier Special Reserva (2013) by Brouwerij De Dolle Brouwers at Muzeum Azji i Pacyfiku

Kosmos... migdaly, ciemne owoce, waniliowe jakies rzeczy, flandersowo winne, drewno, super zbalansowane, alko po smaku ocenilem na 7%, czad

 
Rami Rami: Jest tez mocno slodkie. W nosie nieco ocet. Kosmiczne piwo, duze wow!!!
Rami Rami: Najlepszy flanders jaki pilem w zyciu. I o :)

Rami Rami: 100 lat pan Maciek!!!!

Special Reserva 2007, aperta l'11 marzo 2017.
Rossa limpida con riflessi color rubino, schiuma beige non troppo persistente.
Aroma di susina, fichi secchi, prugna, aceto di mele, barrique.
Al palato prevale la componente acetica, mela verde, barrique, cantina, finale legnoso ed acetico con una nota di fichi secchi e la prugna che accompagna tutta la bevuta.
Astringente, molto carbonata, corpo medio-leggero.

De Dolle Oerbier Special Reserva 2013
Pachnie trochę jak wnętrze browaru Cantillon :D Ogrom drewna, vanilia, wiśnie, ciemne winogrona, karmel, nuta dymiono-palona, czerwone wino, nieco funku. Nos jest tutaj cudowny, taka złożoność, ogrom nut aromatyczny, wzzystko intensywne o świetnie zgrane.
Smak mocno wytrawny, lekko kwaśny, delikatna słodycz praktycznie tylko nadaje piwu kremowości i gładkiej faktury. Ciało nie jest za duże, ale to też przyczyną głębokiego odfermentowania. W smaku też ogrom się dzieje; jest bardzo winnie, są też dojrzałe wiśnie, dużo drewna, mokrej skóry, nuta karmelu. Posmak bardzo wytrawny, taniczny, winny, długi i interesujący. W tle lekki i przyjemny alkohol, piwo ma w końcu 13%. Jeśli ktoś by dostał to piwo na ślepo, to nie ma możliwości żeby nie pomylił go z winem. Cudowny, złożony i pyszny trunek. Wybitnie do powolnej degustacji i cieszenia się każdym wąchnięciem i łykiem.

Bottle shared with ebone1988 for the Koleminer20 turns 3k and Ebone1988 turns 1.6k Bonanza. 330 mL bottle received in a trade with berntholer, vintage 2012, bottled 2013. The pour is a darker brown color with a couple shreds of ruby coming through. There is a thicker egg shell colored head that falls to a thick ring and film leaving a few spots of lace. The aroma is really winey. There is a strong grape fruitiness and a good wine barrel character to it that Im not crazy about. Its decently crisp and clean but there is a bright wine character. The flavor isnt as good. Its more wine forward with a heavy grape and a strong barrel character. This isnt really my jam. The mouth feel is crisp and clean and carries a good bit of carbonation and a lingeringly wine barrel and hint of grape on the back end. Its good, but its not that good.

Bottle shared with koleminer20 for the Koleminer20 Turns 3k and Ebone1988 turns 1.6k Bonanza. For the book. 2012 vintage, bottled 2013. Aroma is wine, barrel, sweet fruit, tart, sour, floral, good. Appearance is red brown, light brown head, mostly hazy. Taste is woody, some wine, fruity, tart, sour, eh. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, woody wine tart aftertaste. Overall, Im not as impressed as I thought I would be.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2017 Gedronken januari 2017; flesje van 2012:
Mooie geur met tonen van van (wilde?) gist. Complexe zurige smaak in balans: licht azijn, lichte eik, licht zoet; rond en mooie tannine. In de afdronk iets jong, jonger dan 5 jaar oud bier zou doen vermoeden. 

Gedronken februari 2017; flesje van 2010:
De smaak is doorleefde, gerijpter, en krijgt nu een 9.

Bottle. Sensoric. Brown, medium hazy with small, dirty white head. Good Head retention and poor lacing. Aroma with quite strong acetone, vinegar accents, moderate oaky character. Moderately fruity (apple), woody and citric. Taste is sweet (thats nice and surprising), later one semi-dry and finally lightly bitter and sour. For that ABV highly drinkable, just a slight warming (or maybe this is subjective). In summary really complex beer, youll find here everything - sweet, sour, dry, bitter, oaky, maltiness, some fruity character. Everything perfectly balanced. Outstanding.
Clear dark bourgondien, tanned foam ring remaining. Sour & Sweet in aroma and taste, quite fresh, cherries. Great. (Essen 201612)
UPDATED: DEC 28, 2016 Dit lijkt meer op een goede wijn dan op wat ik me in eerste instantie bij bier voorstel. Echt heel erg lekker! Ik heb de 2013-versie op.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. 2005 vintage. Rewelacyjny, niesamowicie zbalansowany i ułożony, kwaśny Belgian Strong Ale. Wybitne piwo.

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2016 Big smell of plum! Cask smell ? Amazing!

Appearance is brownish with a lot of undesirable things floating around like some cork particles in a bad wine.

Taste of passed fruits salads very sour but a good sourness masking the abv of this beer.

Iam a bit confused about the sourness as it is too much or not?!
But for a first try at sour beer it is definitely amazing.
12oz bottle of 2007 release. Pours a dark reddy brown color. Sour aroma. Delicious delicate sour red ale. Some cherry and plum flavor.

Bottle at home. Murky, semi-opaque brown pour with a tan head. Huge notes of red grapes, grape vinegar, grape skin, vanilla, sherry, dried fruit. Medium to full body, medium carbonation and a sour, somewhat acidic finish.

Shared from bottle thanks to Maakun! Clear red brown with no head. Almost no smell. Red grapes, prunes, goji berries, wine, light balsamico. Light sweet and bitter and about medium sour. Under medium body, almost no carbonation, bit dry feel.

Bottle shared. Clear teak with short lasting beige head. Sweet cherries, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, oak, hay, acetone, dried herbs, quite some red wines with dry oak tannins, lots of oxidized fruit juices and sherry, dead leaves. Almost medium sweet and sour with lasting alcoholic and herbal bitterness. Over medium bodied. Great beer, but maybe a bit too much acetone for me. Doesnt feel like 13% at all.

Bottle 0,33 thanks to Slacker. Pours dark amber with large off-white head. Aroma is sour with notes of red berries, wood, dusty. Taste is also sour with notes of berries, wood, tobacco, a bit dusty. Alcohol is not noticeable at all. Medium body and average carbonation.

Bottle. 2009 vintage. Delices & Caprices, Brussels. Rusty, ruby red. Would have been without haze, but I do like to pour in the yeast. Film, and dense ring of beige head. Nose has burnt raspberry and cherry. Black cherry stone. Some red wine barrel. Bit of oaky vanilla. Some very light oxidation. Some fruity esters. Smells fantastic. Taste is fruity, estery sweet, getting tart, unripe cherry sour. Never feels the ABV. Soft acidity. Foamy mouthfeel. Dry, tangy, cherry stone finish. Lovely.

Vörösesbarna "sour ale"-költemény, tojásfehér krémhabbal, élénk, szinte vad aroma-kompozícióval, ami nyilvánvalóan a fanyar mondanivaló körül koncentrálódik, mely azonban nem válik uralkodóvá; a balzsamecetes, éretlen jegyek mellett zöldalmás, cseresznyés, marcipános, belga élesztős árnyalatok is megvillannak. A likőrös hangulatok is leginkább illatában vannak jelen, hiszen a legnagyobb talányként az alkoholfok feltüntetett mértéke említhető, ami ízvilágára a legkisebb mértékben sem nyomja rá a bélyegét, sőt... Nem az a könnyfakasztó savanyúság, elegáns vonalakkal megáldott karakter, mely kellőképpen gyümölcsös, meglehetősen részletgazdag, többféle árnyalatban játszó. Néhol vörös -, néhol sárga gyümölcsök képe tűnik elő, máskor száraz boros, érett, fás hangulatok hordozója, mindenesetre izgalmas és könnyedén fogyasztható főzet.
Very drinkable sour. Tart cherries, caramel in the aroma, slightly acetic, slight vanilla (oak?), Slightly medicinal. Complex. Delicious.

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2016 2008. Tonaca di frate con sottilissima schiuma evanescente. Nota al naso acidula, berries. Al palato conferma di essere acidula, con corpo pieno, intensa e corposa. Acidula di mela e dolce di bacche, fruttata e vinosa. Carbonazione medio bassa. Molto intensa e piena ma non eccessivamente impegnativa in piccole dosi, nonostante la gradazione alcolica elevatissima. La oerbier è fantastica, questo invecchiamento in botte aggiunge una interessante nota acida e vinosa.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2016 330ml bottle. 2010 vintage, thanks laiti! Pours dark reddish brown with a foamy head. Aroma of berries, malts, ripe fruits and earthy notes. Taste is heavy, sweetish and malty with some sourish berries, vinous notes, toffee and ripe fruits. Finish is smooth, slightly sweetish and malty with some oak, wood, sourish vinous berries, yeast and earthy notes. Heavy.

An unusual smooth and balance sour red/brown ale. Unfortunately a bit to high carbonation. That destroyed the picture a bit.Clear amber color with a fine tan head. Ok lacing. Looks good. Nice and balanced intensity in the aroma. Not as full body as expected for a beer at 13%. A bit to rich carbonation. Lovely balance between sourness/acidity/sweetness. Oily texture. Oak, vinous, mild vinegar, toffee and fruity. Dangerously well masked alcohol.[Bottle (2012 version) from a trade with JefVerstraete]

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2016 330ml bottle bought in France, tasted at Jameys. Vintage 2013. Pours a dark reddish brown with a white head. Aroma is candied cherries, winey, barrels, sweet apples, some yogurt notes - wow! Taste is winey, cherries, apples, still good, but aroma is a slightly better. Cherries, woodish, veeery long finish. Amazing!

Brewed in 2013 bottle. Peppery, woodsy and sweet grape notes on the aroma. Pours deep brown with nice head retention that fades away. The taste is on point with sour port wine that fades into smooth oak. Deep vinous flavor that carries through the whole swallow.

12 ounces bottle from Craft Beer Cellar Waterbury. Aroma: nose of funky cherries, light vinegar notes dust. App: clear burgundy, minimal off white head, little lacing. Taste and palate: light body, light sweetness, lively carbonation, fruity a lot, clean acidity finish. Overall: well made. Easy to drink. Not as balsamic vinegar as other Sour Red. After half the bottle I decided to have a look at the bottle and realized this was 13% abv. I honestly would have never guessed. Really well hidden and to me on this kind of beer this is a success. Yes it does feel a tad warm in the throat after swallowing it but not that much. Deserves one more point for it. Really well done. Glad I bought this one.

UPDATED: MAY 19, 2016 Many thank to Tommy for the opportunity! It pours a medium red with a thin offwhite head that leaves good lacing. Nose is of acetone, wine, dust, musty oak and alcohol. Taste is of juicy red grapes, wine and oak. Too bad the nose was a little off, otherwise it would have scored much better! Moderate body and carbonation. Vinous. A good barrel aged quadrupel but I expected a lot more from it! Ill certainly give it another try soon!

Réserve 2007, bue après 9 ans. Robe brune-orangée sans col de mousse. Arômes dacide acétique, pomme verte, bois, cerise. En bouche, pomme, petits fruits mûrs, cuir, abricot. Beaucoup de notes vineuses. Texture légère et corps mince moyen. Solide pour une bière de 9 ans dâge.

Hazy dark reddish-brown color with light brown head. Aroma is typical for an oud bruin. Red, sour wine, dark fruits and some caramel underneath. Taste starts tart but not too intense. It has the specific balsamic vinegar taste but the dark fruits and caramel are also present. Not very acidic like others oud bruins. Medium, soft body and carbonation. The listed ABV seems unbelievable, there is no alcohol burn or taste, just a slight warmth. I wouldnt have guessed its more than 8%. Overall its a really well made and easy drinking flanders oud bruin, one of the best I ever had.

2012 Bottle at home courtesy of Slacker Mads, big thanks for this want Id been searching for for a while!opaque deep ruby brown, tan lacing, rich tart balsamic aroma, full bodied, woody, warming booze, balsamic raspberries, red fruit, sourness becoming more integrated as it airs, very rewarding

From a 330 ml bottle into a St Bernardus tulip glass. Label says 12%, brewed and bottled in 2002. Damn...I must have had this in some hidden corner!! Pours brown with small head and lace. Big aroma of dark roasted malts, brown sugar, dark candy sugar, molassas, mangos, rum. Medium carbonation and big mouthfeel. Whooo big first flavors of sour mash and fermented tropical fruit rinds. Its gotten more funky than what I would call a funky Belgian when fresh!! I cant rate this beer on this aged specimen, but Ill add my numbers from a 1 year old.
I should also note that I think the De Dolle Stille Nacht fresh or with several years of age is worthy of a top 100 or better best beers on earth. That De Dolle brew rocks!
Reserva 2012. Donker roodbruin bier met dunne beige schuimkraag. Geur: Coca Cola zonder koolzuur! + een klein geuze geurtje. Smaak: tanine, zuur, fruitig. Afdronk: zurig  bitterig.

33cl bottle enjoyed @ home, 2012 vintage. Pours hazy brown/ruby with a frofthy tan head. Aroma is sour cherries, woody, cranberries, vinous, acidic, unripe dark fruits, caramel and sour apples. Flavour is medium sour and light sweet. Full bodied, thin texture, average carbonation. Finish is dry, tart, vinous anda tiny hint af alcohol.

Bottle 0.33l at Ma che siete venuti a fa Rome Italy 03.12.2015.Taste with ippopotamo36 bro.Special thanks of course to Manuele.Big Ciaone.I think Special reserva 2008.Pour it hazy brown color with no head.Aroma of sourish, brett, reminds me on Rodenbach little bit.Taste of cherries, wodden note, quite dry finish.Really a pleasure.Thanks Manuele again.
33cl bottle at cerveteca Lisbon, Portugal. Brown red color. Head is thin to medium and beige. Medium sweetness, very balanced sourness. Aroma is vinegar, grapes, wood, red fruits, chocolate.
Backlog. 2009 bottle ->mini snifter from Churchkey Vintage Vault event. Brite brown with small offwhite head. Quite tart, with some caramel, fruit, oak. Good.

Rating #1500, Vintage 2013. Not even that cloudy, but beautiful amber color with a red wineish highlight and a tan head. Aroma is cherries, berries, malt behind there, a vineous character as well. Taste is complex fruits, slight tartness, vineous character, malts, tannins, low but still ticklish carbonation. Incredible complexity paired with an incredible drinkability. It has many of the typical "dark sours" aromas, but everything with a superb balance. 13 ABV not present at all. Absolutely beautiful.

Brown to dark brown colored, unclear, small+ beige head. Aroma is of fruits, candy, tart fruit, bubblegum fruity, licorice, winey. Taste is medium sweet caramel and sugar, dark fruity bubblegum, licorice, spicy, some oaky vanilla, low to moderate tartness, winey, alcohol is noticeable along with the boozy warmth. Full bodied, soft carbonation, thick. Very nice!
(bottle, De Dolle Brewery, Diksmuide)

Bottle - Vintage 2007 - Soured malts and cherry with some light charred wood. Cloudy brown with a decent beige head. Nice tartness, soured malts and dark fruity notes and a nice tart finish. Very nice.

330ml bottle. @home 22-11-2015.
Bottled: April 2015.
In short: doped Grand Cru.
Pours hazy dark copper with nice light tan head. Short head retention, poor lacing. Tart, wood, sherry nose, intense aromas. Medium body, soft carbontion, oily texture. Taste is quite tart, vinous character, port, sherry, dried fruits, raisins, plums, caramel, with a strong bitter aftertaste. Maybe a bit saturating.

Botella, @Lambicus, Barcelona. 14/11/2015.Botella 2013
Color marrón oscuro, sabor madera,agrio, final dulce, muy compleja, alcohol integrado.

75cl bottle, tasting @ Chez Alain, Rennes. Tasted 2012 and 2013 vintages. Hazy to clear medium brown with an average frothy head. Sweet caramel, dry fruits, wood, sour finish. Complex and tasty. 2013 vintage a bit mellower than 2012.

New Beer Distributors, NYC bottle: pours brown with a whitish head with brown notes. Aroma is wood, cherries, acid, wine, and vinegar. Taste is strongly sour especially on the first sip. Alcohol is well covered. Plenty of tree and berry up in there. Aftertaste is what you would expect. Not as complex as expected, but still has excellent flavour.

Bit Evolution. Acid but not overwhelming. However, the acid hides everything else in aroma and taste. Not my kind of beer, more for the people who like wine I suppose. However, I have to recognize that they make an excellent job in hiding the 13% alcohol. I didnt feel it in aroma, taste nor effect.

2013 version
In short: caramely acidic beer.
Aroma: caramel and tofee at first, goes to flowers and yeast at the end.
Taste: mild sweet at first, goest to strong sour.
Palate: fizzy acidic lasting sensation.

33cl bottle, the 2013 reserve. Aroma: mineral/wet stone, grapeskins, some alcohol; a rich blast of sour funk caramel malt in the middle; gentle bitterness, a real rinser, gentle bitterness, and gentle warming, no sight of 13% ABV. Would buy again.

Forceful! Fantastic! A brewer incredible journey! Having a beer in your mouth like this is a meravela to remember it. A beer reserved for the few, both for herself and for style and price. I was speechless. Really all products from De Dolle are very good. This long remember the pleasantly.

Bottle in Brugges with Brian & Holly. 2013 Bottle. Pours dark Muddy Brown with a Cream coloured head. Caramel, sour cherries and booze. Its tart and tangy. Oaky and dry. Mouth puckering initially. Fruity yet savoury. A very interesting beer.

2013 Bottle - Kulminator. Pours a dark, chestnutty black with a frothy head that makes way for thick sheets of lace. The aroma is amazingly rich and complex. Deep notes of figs, prunes and caramel are apparent. Whiffs of oaky vanilla and cherries signals its sour character yet I was surprised to find the flavor more barnyard-y than anticipated. A dry hit of oak hits the tongue, quickly revealing cherries and the layers of flavor of the classic Oerbier. As I write this review I am sipping its younger cousin, which I must admit, feels far more balanced to me. The Special Reserva is just as complex, as smooth, as rich, but the heavy-handed oak does not improve it, to my taste.

Brewed 2013, bottled April 2015. A dark brown with red notes, a head is quite small and beige. Aroma has richness of cherries and raspberries, balsamico, some grapes and prunes. Taste has cherries, medium sourness, earthyness, grapes. Slightly sticky, almost full bodied. Good beer and not too sour.
Been a minute since Ive had this one. Brown pour. Tinges of red. Small tan head. Little lacing. Nice soft acetic nose. Malty and dark fruity. Taste is a pleasant revisit of the nose. Very nice.

2012 bottle thanks to berntholer! Pours a burgundy shade of brown with a large salmon-pink head which remains. Aroma is cherries, red grapes and some funk. Taste is tart cherries, moderate reminiscence of nuts (brazil nuts and walnuts), raspberries and a hit of red wine. Tart and fruity.
Bottle at Kulminator. Aroma of sour oak, red fruit and barnyard. Taste of sour red fruit, oak, sour milk, mild vanilla and smooth cherry, long finish. Very nice.

Questa Speciale Reserva 2010 ha un colore ramato profondo, tendente al rossiccio; la schiuma non è molta, marrone chiaro e di scarsa persistenza. Olfatto complesso, fruttato di ciliegie sotto spirito e di prugne, vinoso alcolico, leggermente acetico, terroso, con qualche sensazione di legno. In bocca è aspra ed acida, citrica, ma soprattutto vinosa ed acetica, molto carbonata, alcoolica (13% dichiarati!) che ti picchia dura nel palato, ma anche fruttata, di ciliegia e prugna, e sotto sotto una base dolce con i suoi malti... e la vaniglia del legno. Una leggera astringenza finale, corpo normale, quasi esile vista la gradazione.

2013 bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Dark reddish brown color, small white head. Rich aroma has cherries, sweet sugar notes, wine notes. Cherries, wine, caramel, sour apple notes. Very complex and tasty.

Brown bottle, 11.2 ounces, 2012 vintage, bottled in SEP2012, savoured on July 3 2015; eye: dirty brown, thin sheet of mocha head that turns into a ring, slight lacing; nose: acidity, cherry, small dark berries, musk, light wild yeasts, earthy; mouth: acidity, cherry, small dark berries, musk, light wild yeasts, small berries acridness, light tannin, finale in black currant with good presence of malt, medium-full body, average carbonation, mildly sweet, slick texture; overall: 	 fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 11,2 onces, 13 %, millésime 2012, embouteillée en SEP2013, savourée le 3 juillet 2015; il : brun sale, trouble, mince couverture de mousse moka qui se transforme en un anneau, très légère dentelle; nez : acidité, cerise, petits fruits noirs, musc, léger levures sauvages, terreux; bouche : acidité, cerise, petits fruits noirs, musc, léger levures sauvages, âcreté de petits fruits, léger tanin, finale en cassis avec bonne présence de malt, corps moyen-corsé, carbonatation moyenne, moyennement sucrée, texture coulante; en résumé : bien

11,2 oz bottle multiple times from notes. Pours a clear dark amber brown color with a medium sized off white head. The aroma and flavor have Belgian character, sweetness balanced by tart fruit, red wine character, oak, no sign of the abv, I always enjoy seeing this one, a favorite from my early days on the site that I get to revisit from time to time.

330ml bottle (2012) from the brewery. Saved for a special occasion. And that occasion was me running low on beer. Hugely complex sour with all sorts of murky oaky red wine flavours getting a nose in. Powerful, exceptional sour.

2009 bottle.  Pours a dark and hazy brown off white head that stayed around a while. Aroma of tart sour, wood, apples (granny smith) and a touch of dark fruit. Taste is raisin, wood, field grass and apple. A hint of sweetness up front and a gorgeous Dry and refreshing and tart on the finish. Medium MF. Just a fantastic beer.

Poured from a bottle at Birch & Barley, Washington, DC, into a stem glass. Taste back to back with the base. Pours dark mahogany with quickly fading tan head. Nose is grape skin, sour apple, bing cherry, caramel, and rhubarb. Flavour is sour apple and sour cherry. Very tart! There are also notes of wine, oak, caramel, and roasted malts. Exquisite!

Pours clear brown with nearly flat, white head. Aroma of apples, grass, red grapes and cherries. Taste is medium sour tart, very balanced with light sweetness in the finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.
Poured dark reddish brown with a frothy tan head. Aroma of sweet musty berries, light peat. Full body, flavour is vinous, moderately sour, light liquorice.
Very dark brown with creamy head. Spiced light sour cherry aroma. Sour, with a hint of sweet, and cherry notes. Good palate cleanser. Nice lacing on the glass. Very smooth and silky, excellent stuff.
Bottle @the brewery. Strong vinous aroma, very fruity, medium soureness. Incredibly complex. Wow.
Deze reserva drink ik in de oerbar van de dolle brouwers het heeft een pure wijn smaak en vooral geur

Mahogany pour, silky coffee colored head. Nose is candi sugar, apples, some funk. Taste is candi sugar, tart apple, apple skins, oak barrel. Oily smooth mouthfeel. Unbelievable beer, doesnt surprise me that people say this improves exponentially with age.

2005 Vintage at Kulminator. Served in Oerbier Glass at cellar temparture.

A - Its black in the bulb tulip but edges are dark brown and almost translucent.

S - The aroma is amazing. Loads of dark fruits, plum, fig, raisin and burnt sugar. I smell a little bit of apple.

T - Taste Is unreal. Oak, sugar, pears and apples with blueberry and Brett funk. The sugar is caramelized and taste is unreal. 13% ABV and you dont even taste it. 

M - Oily mouthfeel but fills the mouth with some carb.

O - Simply a remarkable beer! Its incredible.

33cl bottle, ?2002 Vintage shared@ BBF 15 Vintage Tasting ZO, merci. A surprisingly light Pinot Noir/Spätburgunder berry tartness with some barrel brett in aroma gives way to full-on aged wine flavours like malt bonbons dunked into woody sherry, ruby port and cherries. Surfacing old, macerated madeira notes kept in check by good dryness and drinkability.

Bottle @ Brugs Beertje, 2012 vintage. Pours a ruby red beer with a big beige head on top. Aroma is rather vineous, red fruits, leather coats. Very complex with deep notes of all sorts of stuff, fruits, nuts and earthy aromas. Flavor is medium tarty, vineous, oaky and has a high level of carbonation and a dry, tarty finish. Very interesting, great complexity and the alcohol is very wel hidden. Great stuff.

Bottle @ De Dolle, Esen - BE. Color: dark brown beer with velvet reflection, really small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: sweet malt with red fruits notes as raspberry and redcurrant presence. Barrel notes and red vine. Taste: amazing complexity! Red fruity and red wine barrel, really nice equilibrium of malt and caramel with sour notes. Aftertaste: caramel, red fruits and alcohol finish.

2008: 330ml bottle given to Mat and me by Fin. We in turn, we split it with three other members of the Shrewsbury Bottle Exchange Group on 12th Jan 2015. 
Ruby red/brown colour with an off white head. Malty, fruity and sour with a mini wine hint in the taste. Just a little to acidic for my palate but all the other four thought it a fantastic beer.
Bottle thanks to mora..Pour is dark red with a bubbly tan head..Nose is brown sugar, funk, vinegar, oak, spice..Taste is spice, oak, musty, oak, dry, cinnamon..

Bottle bought at the brewery. Gusher!r Pours dark with nice head. Aroma has oak, red wine, malt, vinegar. Taste has lots of the red wine, yeasty, sweet as well. Lots of grapes (wine again). 
Nice!
Bottle. Brown colour with off white head. Malt, caramel, fruity, wine aroma. Sour, sweet, malt, caramel, wine, fruity taste. Medium to full body.

Dark brown color with a light beige head with medium retention and mild lacing. Aroma has notes of redfruits, wine barrels and wood. Flavor is sourish, very fruity, red and wine mouthfeel. Sour and bittery final with red wine mouthfeel on palate

330ml bottle, v2005, shared at the Local Pub, Athens, courtesy of Spiros. Dark red brown color with small beige head. Aroma is malty and tart yeasty, dark fruits, caramel, wood and brandy-like alcohol. Taste is sweet (sugary) and light sour like the aroma. Light to medium body, oily, soft carbonation and dry finish.
Bottle. Color dark orange with small light brown head. Aroma sweet, sour, citrus. Taste sour, dry, dust.

Sampled @ O.B.E.R. Kerstbierfestival 2014, Essen.

Dunkel rötlichbraunes Bier mit wenig beigem Schaum. Geruch leicht säuerlich fruchtig, röstmalzig, holzig, Vanille. Geschmack röstmalzig, säuerlich fruchtig, alkoholisch, holzig, Vanille, gut!
2009 Shared by Thomas. Murky brown with lots of small sediment. Aroma is vinegar, oak. Sour but not as much as the aroma indicates, fruity red wine... Nice

Bottle from Bruges. Poured a murky brown, with a tiny halo of off white head. Aroma of cherries, vinegar, brown sugar and caramel. Burnt sugar in the flavour, with some alcohol soaked fruit and vinegar. Finish was dark malt, booze and acidic fruit.
A: Caramel, cherry, coffee T: Honey in the aftertaste, figs, apricot, very vineous!

UPDATED: FEB 1, 2015 Pours semi dark with tiny head. Smell is brettanomyces with cask wood : very intense spectrum of aromas. Oerbier, balsamic, vanilla, brett, oak, sweet melasse.. Mmm smells very vinous. Taste lots of wine, pediococcus, malt, citrus, rotting wine barrel, yeast, warming, overripe fruits & berries. Waw!

Bottle. Pours thick dark murky amber with very nice beige head. Aroma is oaky, wood and red wine. Slight tart fruits and funky yeast. Dry red wine. Taste is sweet and tart. Grapes and lot of vanilla too. Big, fizzy and lively body. Finish is dry wooden and some heat, but not alcoholic at all. Tartness stays in the mouth.

2012 edition bottle thanks to Lukasmh. Pours Dark, murky amber/brown with a Nice, lasting, off white head. Aroma has fresh wood, vanilla, cherries, slight funk and some leather-dry notes. Taste is pretty dry and tart up front. Almost a little sour heat in the end, vanilla, dry wood. And 13% abv!?! Where did that go? Wow, this is nice and elegant. Body is surprisingly light and fizzy.... 13??? For Real??

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Au service, on a une belle couleur caramel, la mousse, beige ,diminue vite mais ne disparait pas, et au bout de quelques minutes, ressemble plus à la crème dun café quà de la mousse, et elle tient..ça fait bien vingt minutes quelle est dans le verre sans que jy touche,et elle na pas bougé.... non je suis pas maso, mais en ce jour spécial, je me fais un plaisir de lire et répondre aux messages de bon anniversaire..allez, le nez, et bien on est bien sur du viellissement en fut, cest trés boisé,vineux,ca naugure que du bon,allez hop ,on se lenvoie derrière la cravate:
Ouch,cest du bon. Rien à voir avec la version normale de la Oerbier, la on est plus clairement sur le boisé, cest vineux, une acidité toute en douceur, le bois a vraiment attaqué la binouze,et cette mousse qui ne bouge pas dun poil malgré les gorgées qui se multiplient,et ce gout vineux qui reste scotché dans les parties les plus intimes de mon palais!!

Bottle split at home with James on the evening of my 40th, 11/10/14 thanks to an IP with Mads who allegedly commutes from DK to BE to do some bar work at the brewery!?!
Murky mahogany brown with a decent beige covering that soon collapses.
Nose is bitter dark fruit rinds, spice, Tabasco, woody must, dank tones, dates, figs, prunes, soured red berries.
Taste comprises more of the same, dark fruit rinds, rich tangy berries, musty wood, tarte berries, straw, earthy, light fruit balsams, acidic tunes.
Medium + body, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a bitter fruit rinse washed with a cloak of subtle acidity.
Solid Flemish red, nice acidic rising towards the end, well balanced, ABV disguised.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
330ml bottle served in a Duvel tulip.
A: Pours a deep amber to brown color. Just a little bit cloudy. Head is yellow/beige medium head. Low retention but never disappeared totally leaving some lacings left
S: Delicious fruity and woody smell. Acid vinegar too. Brown sugar, caramel malts, grapes and apples (strong on apples), yeasts and alcohol. End is acid and metallic. Wine character 
T: Follows the nose: quite fruity and acid. Apples, grapes, barrel wood, brown sugar, caramel malts and yeasts. In overall, an acid/tart beer with a bit sweet upfront. End is dry and a little bit alcoholic. Hop bitterness is mild but stingy. Excellent!
M: Despite the high ABV, an easy drinking beer. In fact, its difficult to believe that its a 13% since the alcohol is very discreet. Medium and bit molasses body and a reasonable carbonation to such ABV
O: Very drinkable and well done beer. One of the best Belgian beers Ive ever had
[ BA Review @ 3/31/2012 ]

#700. Bottle, 2004 vintage, shared at SW bottle share. Pours mahogany with a scant off white head. Aroma is tart cherry, cinnamon spice, some earthy oxidation. Taste is caramel, sour cherry and some earthy oxidation. Smooth. No sharpness left in the flavor. Id say this is past its prime but still drinking quite well. 13%? Id never believe it if it wasnt printed on the bottle!
#700 1/2. Bottle, 2012 vintage. Color is more red than above, lots more carb. Aroma is more floral, no oxidation. Sharp tart cherry flavor, caramel is present, but less, no earthy oxidation. Rate is for 2012 vintage, 2004 gets a solid 3.9.

Bottle: 2013 vintage: Served in a Chouffe glass:
Hazy red ish brown with a medium to smaller sized light beige head.
Beautiful aroma of oak, berries, grapes, wilder yeast, light vinous, some fruity tart tones, some hints of spices and some light hints of ginger bread.
Flavour is wild yeast, bitter, light tart, berries, some fruity dust or dusty fruit with tart edges, some oak, malts, light vinous and some spices.
Aftertaste is berries, but dry, wood, wilder yeast, bitters...
Low carbo, light watery mouthfeel, close to full body and a light spicy light watery dry texture. Nice stuff! Close to complex... Balanced and tasty!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: "13%. not expecting sour, but it was definitely there in the flavor and aroma. what a nice little surprise. very complex. fruity malt, vinous, oak, tart, all rolled into a nice little package. not available around here or id get more."
Bottle @Bierhuyske. Pours dark brown with off-white head. Aroma is fruity, bit sour, red wine. Taste is a bit sour, fruity. Medium body. Nice one.

Bottle shared by a kind soul in a location remote of my dining room. 

The beer pours a hazy red with a good head and some lacing on the glass.

The aroma is sour cherries, oak, tart fruit, and mild vinegar. Its got almost a soft nose, its not that its not aromatic, but nothing is especially pronounced either. 

The flavor is nicely sour & plenty woody. Its got some light booze but it most defiantly does not come off as a 13%er Its got plenty of tart most especially cherries and pears. Its rich without being awfully sweet. 

Certainly something Ive wanted to try for a long time, and like with many things of this nature Im sure there are bottles/years that would just blow the mind, this shows the potential to do that, and while being extraordinarily enjoyable it wasnt quite there for me in that mind blowing capacity.
Peu à voir avec lOerbier classique. Celle ci est sirupeuse, acide et très complexe. Fantastique.

Oak aged version of Oerbier, made for the first time in 2002 and at that time the strongest Belgian beer along with Dubuissons Bush Prestige (but surpassed since then by some Alvinne and Struise brews). Yellowish white, irregular, dense, very stable head (certainly with respect to the alcohol strength), ruby bronze colour, almost clear. Very powerful, unusual, oud-bruin like and vinous aroma of candied cherries, yoghurt, orange liqueur, oak, old sherry, cognac, red wine, dates, Belgian chocolates and apple sauce. Fruity sweetish taste, honeyish, fresh spiciness, soft and deep dark malts with sour component strongly reminiscent of an oud bruin; very vinous mouthfeel from beginning to finish, complex with lots of warming, port-like alcohol, which graciously manages to remain elegant, sweet and agreeable, no sign of astringency despite the ABV. This is a very appetizing, complex, vinous and fascinating ale, almost a mix of oud bruin, barley wine and quadrupel. I recommend collecting each vintage and comparing them since the barrels on which each vintage is aged, tend to differ (so deserve separate entries here!). The first version was not as sourish as later versions, the 2006 version seemed dryer with more tannins and the 2008 version seemed more soft and rounded, with a tad more roasted bitterness. Collectors item and ideal for ageing in the cellar - too bad this brewery doesnt use 75 cl bottles. Since there is only one entry for Oerbier Special Reserva, my scoring here is an average of all the vintages I tasted so far.

Botella de 33 cl de zombier, tomad a en marzo de 2011. Edición elaborada y embotellada en 2009. (consumo pref y lote ilegibles) Cuerpo medio a intenso con 13 vol. Recuerdos bastante ácidos y con abundante gas. Sabores intensos, maltas y ciertos matices de maderas, seria muy conveniente repetirla se nuevo para comparar. Buena, una sorpresa en su momento.

Bottle shared by alexsdad06 pours dark cola brown. Nose light sour and tart, then can smell some of the Belgian candy sweet, hint of tannin. Tatse tart sour up front followed by sweet malt. Mid palate sour continues, followed by sweeter finish.

Botlle @ The brewery, Pours dark brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of malt, oeak, redwine, dark fruits, raisins, caramel, tart cherries. Flavor is light sourness, malty, oak, redwine grapes, dark fruits, raisins, caramel, cherries. Medium body, average carbonation, light acidic finish. 030814

2012 bottle. Pour is copper with ruby edges and a tight light tan head. Nose is sour cherry, light oak and vanilla, a bit of acetic acid. Taste is quite nice, acetic acid fades away, sour cherries are very well integrated with oak and vanilla. A bit of malt mid to late palate. Well balanced and very tasty, lighter body and very well carbonated.

(Bottle, vintage 2008) Dark brown colour with frothy, beige head. Fruity, vinous nose with caramel, oak wood, dried fruit (raisins, prunes), cherries, red wine and a slight acidity. Fruity, vinous, tart taste with notes of caramel, red fruit, wine, oak wood, cherries, a hint of chocolate and a tart, vinous finish with warming alcohol. Almost full body, with a touch of sweetness and a fair amount of sourness. Possibly not very well balanced, but very tasty and quite interesting. Excellent beer.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2016 May 29, 2016. Bottle, brewed in 2012.
Sweet caramel, dried fruit, tart cherries, dry oak and vinous notes. Great!
 
Original rating:

July 12, 2014. Bottle, brewed in 2012. Pours clear red with a small frothy off-white head. Aroma is tart cherries, oak, vanilla, red wine, slight aceton. Taste is tart up front with an increasing dry oak note, slight sharp high alcohol finish, dry woody tart finish. Body is light/medium and fairly lively carbonation. A bit too much nail polish for me. 
8-4-6-3-14=35
Amazing beer. Aroma: Cherry, wine notes, berries, vanilla, leather. Taste is very compex; wine, oak, caramel, medium sourness. Alcohol is quite well balanced for a 13%. Ace beer

2010 Vintage Hazy almost clear deep amber pour with a thin slightly lively off white head .... aroma is sour and a bit acidic with red vinous notes, dark fruits .... taste is of light vinous notes, acidic, sour, dark fruits, oak, with some cherry and apple to it ..... dry and a little lively with a light bitter and dry finish .... absolutely no trace of abv and this has aged so well ... loving this ....... 2006 Vintage Darker amber color with a small beige head ... aroma is of very light smoke and dark fruits ..... taste is a bit smoked oak, sour vinous notes, lightly acidic and more of a softer carbonation than the 2010 ... finish is not as dry with still a decent light bitter bite and acidic .... For 13% abv this beer is made extremely well I enjoyed the fresher vintage more

Bottle, brewed in 2009. Hazy chestnut brown with a bubbly diminishing tan head. Mouthwatering complex nose, vinous, oak, very light acetone, over ripe fruit. Aroma delivers the same things; clean notes of oak, dusty, redcurrant, raspberry, light acetone, light red wine. Medium body, no telling of the alcohol except a nice warming feel from deep within, where the good beers hit the spot. Medium sweet, little bitterness, light acidic. So light and still so complex and drinkable with no alcohol burn despite the abv. This is insanely good, cant ask for more. Good price as well.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours reddish brown with some sediment and an off-white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are oak, berries, vanilla, and tartness - with a tart finish.

This beer is a peach. No matter the price, grab one immediately. Red wine body with medium carbonation gives rise two a bubbly off white head. Nose of red berries and aged wood gives you a heads up for whats in store. A lovely balanced flavor of sour and sweet comes from hints of cherries, raspberries, grapes, yeasty notes and a hefty backbone of a lovely wood taste. Simply delicious.

2012 bottle. Pours hazy light brown with a small head that fades almost instantly. Aroma has some red wine, red berries and very little funk. The high ABV shines through in the start but disappears as it warms up. Taste has light balsamico, red currants, grapes and some vanilla.

Brewed 2009, bottled in 2010. 
Aroma is fairly fruit with a lot of dark, tart cherries, berries and cassis with lighter plum and some fruit. Light oak notes. Light toasted bread and caramel with medium light acidity. 
Pours a fairly clear, burnt amber brown with a fairly large, thick tan head with pretty nice retention. Slowly recedes until a thin film is left then it seems to stop. Light leaving and medium legs. 
Flavor is fairly tart upfront but some malt character of toasted bread and caramel does show through. Medium fruit notes of cherries, berries and cassis with lighter notes of raisins and plums. Medium light oak notes and light alcohol spice in the finish. Some lingering acidity and fruit in the finish. Light bitterness. 
Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation and a crisp, dry finish. Low astringency and medium alcohol warmth. 
Overall a superb, high alcohol sour red/brown ale. Really nice fruit notes and balance acidity that still allows some malt character to show. Nice light oak notes.

2006 bottle. Pour is deep murky reddish brown with a thin beige head. Aroma is tart and woody with notes of berries, red wine, and oak. Flavor is quite tart up but that quickly gives way to faint cedar notes followed by flavors of cherry pie, dry red wine, and faint holiday spice. The finish is butter toffee, earthiness, and more oaky red wine. No alcohol anywhere to be found. This may be the most complex sour brown I have ever had. Wow, thats pretty amazing stuff.
Vintage 2010. Brune légèrement rougeâtre. Nez de liège mouillée. Bouche un peu trop mince: griottes et barrique avec un côté vineux et acétique. Un peu dastringence en finale et des notes terreuses.

Brewed in 2008.
Aroma estupendo, intenso, extraordinario, único! Definitivamente muy prometedor. 
Las notas percibidas van desde el sabor ácido, agrio, algo vinoso, ligeramente vinagre. Sin embargo también se perciben notas frutales intensas, principalmente uvas y berrys, quizá no tan frescas, más bien un poco añejas.

Apariencia cómo el estilo lo requiere, tonalidades rojizas, algo opaca y turbia. Cuerpo redondo, corona de espuma prácticamente nula, carbonatacion baja.

En bocaexquisita, fresca, frutal, ácida. 

En boca es una cerveza fuerte, intensa y potente. No por nada esos 13 grados. En primera instancia se percibe un picor en lengua y un dulzor y sabor completamente frescos y frutales, tal cómo el aroma lo indicaba, uvas y berrys, sin embargo posteriormente se perciben las notas ácidas y es cuando el añejamiento, tiempo- barril, se presentan de forma extraordinaria. Un buen equilibrio inicial, y un final fuertemente dominado por el sabor ácido.

En resumen una excelente cerveza representante del estilo, extraordinario pero para beberse tranquilamente y disfrutarse al 100%.
Amazing sour beer, thank you GT2, so good, delicious bottle not sure where he got this but awesome

2012 vintage. Pours a beautiful tawny port or sherry color, small light-tan head that quickly subsides. Aroma is mysterious and evocative: grapes, port, balsamic vinegar, stone fruit, red wine, amari, oak, mild cheese, salinity. Love it. Taste is brightly acidic with a long finish: sour plums, raspberries, black currant, balsamic, sherry, oak. Booze is more apparent than would be ideal. Still, a challenging masterpiece and one of my favorites. A beer to contemplate.

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2014 shared a bottle at a bar. poured a dark ruby colour with a tan head. sour cherries, red grapes, some vinegar, tart, oak, red wine, earth flavour, great complex beer, such a great mouthfeel. the barrel aging has turned the oerbier in a real monster! awesome beer!

Bu en bouteille de 33cl brassin de 2012 à la brasserie, couleur sapprochant étonnament du Poulsard cest à dire rouge vineux en bouche la bière et très vineur et évolue incroyablement avec lair, on part dune bière très acide et ça continue sur lattaque dOerbier, incroyablement bon

33 cL bottle. Pours a dark brown, with a ruby hue, a big, foamy, beige head, and lots of lacing. The nose is tart raspberries, cinnamon, milk chocolate, anise, and chardonnay. Sweet, very sour, with a light, bitter, metallic aftertaste. Medium body, sticky, and very astringent. Significant warming on the way down. The is a great looking, great smelling beer; vinous, dark, and flavorful. Unfortunately, the flavor doesnt balance quite right, it is very boozy, and the palate is a little thin and boozy. Still, quite a good beer.

February 27, 2014. 330 mL 2012 bottle from kevinsenn. Decided to break this one open to celebrate the day before my birthday. Reddish brown colour with white head. Matly, sour aroma, sour cherries dominant with a hint of basalmic vinegar. Very smooth mouthfeel. Tart sour cherry and tart red grape flavours, with a hint of chocolate, earthy undertones. Very complex. Thanks Kevin!

[Bottle / 2006 / 7+ years old] Thanks, Jeff! Burnt sienna colored body with some copper & very timid red around the edges, topped with a khaki & leather looking head... Great for over seven years of age. Nose contains lots of oak, wood, & booze with strong undertones of sour cherry, mild acidity, light cotton funk, & faint tobacco. Taste is lots of boozy cherry up front; slightly tart at first, then flowing into an almost residual-like sweetness. Lots of wood in the flavor; musky with almost a touch of peat-y smoke in the finish. Warmth brings out more berry, lemon flesh, & a hint of acid thats blunted by the strong woody & alcoholic finish. Slick, almost thick mouth feel... Very nice beer that has withstood the test of time. Overall, the booze shines through a little too much given the style, in my opinion, but its still a very well crafted ale.
Bottle from Binnys in Chicago. Pours ruby and hazy. Sharp tart aroma. Sharp vinegar and tart taste.

Bottle pours dark reddish brown with 2 finger head. Nose is funky tart dark fruit, wine, earthy grape and plum. Tate is tart earthy dark cherry, fruity, cola, funk, red wine. Finish is complex wine barrel, funky tart cherry and cola, musty. Excellent!

UPDATED: JAN 17, 2015 Bottle from Tipples here in Gainesville. Date says bottled in September 2013, poured on Jan. 18, 2014. Pours a dark red color, pretty opaque, with a big fluffy off white head that looks creamy and has just a hint of red hue to it. Sour cherry and vinegar aroma, oak presence and even a bit of vanilla. Very nice. Flavor is a big punch of sourness that is a combo between tart cherries and big rich black cherries, vanilla, a punch of very drying oak. Definite vinous notes that gives this a nice warming richness down the throat. Lingering cherries and oak on the palate which starts out big and rich and ends with the lingering dry oak and acidic tartness. This is a really nice treat that I would certainly drink again.
From a 2012 bottle. Pours a hazy reddish brown with an ecru head. Spicy tart apple nose. Flavors of funky apple cider with a crisp champagne-like mouthfeel. Crisp, tart finish.

2008 bottle. Pours dark mahogany in color with an off white, sticky, and a thick head. The aroma is of figs, mild tart cherries, light vinegar, wood, weak carmelized grain. In the flavor all the ingredients blended very well. There was a hint of nicely hidden booze, sweetness, malts, and a pleasant cherry tart finish. Overall a very drinkable beverage and worth a taste.

My 500th recorded rating for New Years Eve, making this my last beer of 2013 and the first of 2014. Feel like I made a good choice with this one.  
330 ml bottle, 2006 vintage. Appearance: Beautiful, clear dark mahogany brown with slight red hue. Light brown head that flourishes before dissipating to a ring. Aroma: Sweet, cherries; plums, figs; some vinegar, oak. Almost dont even want to drink this, it smells delicious. Taste: Despite the sweetness to the nose, the taste is restrained. Mildly sweet up front, balanced by a pleasant tartness that follows, finishing dry. Some oxidation, musty basement, and maybe even a bit of cheese in there, but in a nice way -- this is 7 (now 8?) years young. Alcohol well-masked in taste -- its only after several sips that my body registers how big this is. I want to say something about it being tannic, but I still dont know how to use that descriptor right -- if I did, I expect I could collapse a few of the above sentences into a single word. Vinous and woody, with cherries galore. Rather nice. Palate: Full body, slick, mouth-coating texture, soft, fine-bubbled carbonation. Overall: One of these days Ill track down a fresh bottle and give it a whirl. This is a delight, and Im glad I chose it for tonight.
  
I first started rating beers here because I wanted to better appreciate what I was drinking. I figured the best way to do that would be to concentrate, follow some guidelines, and be forced to write things down. In the last year, I think Ive at times rated more out of habit, or scorekeeping (#40 on the list of users from WA -- yeah!). I get lazy about it, jot down a few words, and sometimes feel like Im stagnating (desipte the growing number of ticks) instead of growing. Id like to return to my original approach in the coming year, rating fewer beers but being more thoughtful about those I do rate. I wonder how long this particular "resolution" is going to last? At any rate, glad to be part of the RB community, and look forward to drinking with you folks in 2014.

2006 bottle bought at Ølbutikken 2013, shared with esp0r, simonsen & edvard september 28th 2013. Dark brown body, big beige head. Aroma of red wine, caramel, bread, fruity hops. Taste is sweet caramel with a sour hint, red berries, caramel, orangey hops, light alcohol. Pleasant warm aftertaste, with a fruity slight acidic finish. A very nice beer.

UPDATED: DEC 27, 2013 At torst with my parents. Pours maroon. Aroma is acidic sour with some Belgium yeast notes. Taste is Belgium yeast, hard oud bruin sour notes. So barrell. Its alright but a little heavy on the belgi yeast notes for me.

Update: at 124 rabbit club with Taylor. Im not getting Belgium fruity yeast this time. Very nice sour.

Pours a rusty brown color with three fingers of gaseous eggshell foam. The nose is a bit restrained but full of intriguing complexity ! Vinous barrel funk, tart cherry, composted fruit, touch of caramel. The palate is bright and funky with tons of vinous funky tart fruit, lots of bordeaux influence, great rustic earthiness as well. Alcohol is very well hidden... Damn fine beer full of a flavor ! Very unique.

Drank a 2009 bottle @ Kulminator. Appearance is great, nice and dark with some foam. The smell is very sour, not my thing. The taste is complex and balanced. Sourness embedded in a nice amount of carbonation. Hints of wine. Alcohol is well hidden. a bit too sour for me.
Köpt på ren chansning. Flaska från 2010. Stor smakbild med sötma och syra i bra balans. 13% alkohol känns inte. Kan anas möjligen men inte så det stör. Härlig kropp

2010.
Un côté vineux marqué juste comme il faut. Amertume bien présente. Et surtout le plaisir d'avoir un de ces trésors en main.

Lote del 2010. Color caoba oscuro con espuma color crema escasa. Aromas marcadamente ácidos y afrutados que recuerdan a uva y ciruela. En boca pica y entra dulce y afrutada. La ácidez es más equilibrada y recuerda a frutos rojos. Muy rica.

Thanks to drowland for this birthday beer. 2009 vintage. Poured nice muddled red brown. Aroma was cherries and dark fruits. The flavor was a perfectly sweet sour blend. No burn. Would never have guessed this at 13% even mellowed for a few years. Fantastic stuff.
Bottle from 16 Tons Taphouse, Eugene. Pours a cloudy medium reddish brown. Little to no head. Aroma amazing, tart, roasty, cherries. Body thick, rich, finish rich and complex. Amazing.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2014 33cl bottle at Gainsbar Kortrijk.
APPEARANCE: deep dark brown beer, nice stable beige head.
NOSE: red wine, sweet, fruity, wood.
TASTE: fruity, alcohol, wood, malty, slightly sour.
Very good beer!

After a long week, decided I needed a good pour...2006 vintage cellared properly for some time. pour is a dank mahogany with a thin tan head that recedes quickly. aroma is sweet, sugary caramel malt, acetic, white wine, tart apples...interesting stuff. flavor caught me a bit off guard...very sour/tart with a heavy vinegar note, but lots of sweet malts, some dark fruits and a hint of rum-like spice. unique. palate is a bit thinner than I anticipated, but not in a bad way. carbonation is low, and i feel like this is on the verge of becoming oxidated. now I need a more recent vintage to enjoy again!

2006 Bottle shared with Simonsen, edvard & daje
Pours dark red with a nice tanned head. Smells of red wine, fuits, malts, dried fruits. Moderate to medium sweet, moderate wine acids, quite fruity, tart berries. A very nice malt base that has got alot of nice wine and oak from the aging prossess on barrels. Excuisite! Tnx to daje for sharing this rare experience
2006. Flaske fra Daje. Drukket på hytta til dag. Brun farge. Lavt karbonert. Sinnsykt god. Rødvin

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, 2010 vintage. Pours very hazy dark ruby red color with a 1-2 finger fairly dense light khaki head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Spotty foamy lacing clings on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big sour cherry, green apple, raisin, red wine, vinegar, oak, clove, pepper, toast, caramel, hay, leather, funk, and yeast earthiness. Fantastic aromas with great balance and complexity of malt, yeast, and barrel notes; with great strength. Taste of big sour cherry, cranberry, green apple, raisin, red wine, clove, oak, vinegar, pepper, leather, hay, caramel, toast, funk, and yeast earthiness. Good amount of earthy/fruity/spicy tartness on the finish; with lingering notes of sour cherry, cranberry, green apple, raisin, red wine, clove, oak, pepper, vinegar, caramel, toast, hay, leather, funk, and yeast earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible balance and complexity of tart/fruity yeast notes with prominent barrel character; with a great malt/tart/spiciness balance and zero cloying flavors after the finish. Medium-high carbonation and medium-full bodied; with a lightly slick, crisp, and moderately acidic mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a small warming present after the finish. Overall this is an absolutely incredible Flanders brown ale! All around outstanding balance and complexity of malt, yeast, and barrel flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A highly enjoyable offering.

Pours red-golden with a quickly settling tan head. Aroma is cherries, honey, cane sugar, caramel, apple brandy. Taste is cherries, figs, caramel, honey, cane sugar, apple, some plum vinegar as well. Very good!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
I am probaly not ready for this kind of beer. I couldnt finish the bottle. Far too sour for me.

330 ml bottle. 2010 vintage. Pours a very dark brown with medium head. Aromas of oak, toffee, vinegar and spice. Flavours of green wood, vinegar, and very sour dark fruit. Vinous. Bitter and sour. Yikes. Off balance even for the style. Very warm.

2009 bottle. Pours cloudy red/brown with off white/crema head which fades quickly. Epic nose of sour fruits, especially cherry. Taste is zingy sour and sweet malt with medium carbo. Warm finish. Really special.

2009 bottle. Pours a deep brown with lots of burnt orange highlights. Thick deep tan head. The smell is rich cherry, dark fruit, yeast, sour and wood. The taste is tannic, dry wood, cherries, dry fruitiness ending woody and dry with sour fruit on the finish. Medium body with active and finely structured carbonation. Special stuff!

2007. Nose is big oak and vinegar, light vanilla. Pours a nice dark red/brown color with a thin head. Tons of yeast. Flavor is mainly oak and sour vinegar and funk. Tannins and vanilla. Very nice with no hint at the ABV.

Bottle, thanks Niall. Gusher. Very dark reddish brown with tan head. Sour notes in the aroma, sharp, spicy cherry, wood, very intriguing. Taste has spicy wood, worscter sauce, cherry, berries. Quite sour. Not at all what I was expecting but very delicious

11.2 oz bottle to snifter (2008 vintage; shared by mikem409).  Looks good; a cloudy brown with beige lacing.  Smells malty and tart with a bit of oak and red wine; like a dark Flanders.  Tastes like it smells with a good mouthfeel.  Enjoyable.
Bottle. Pours murky red with no head. Sour apple and plum aroma. Taste is tart and tangy dried fruit

16/04 A 0.33 l bottle, courtesy of Marko, thanks for sharing! 2010 vintage, at 13% ABV. It poured a hazy brown body with medium sized head. Very nice, slightly sourish, complex aroma. Generally malty, fruity with notes of roasted malt as chicory and burnt sugar, as well as very evident barrel aging. Flavor was sourish as well, quite fruity, but less complex, only with plain notes of wood. Medium body, smooth on palate with alcohol extremely well hidden. Long, slighty sour and sweet finish. Very nice, although nothing near 4s, so these high ratings really surprised me.

330 ml. bottle, 2010.  Thanks Kai!  Pours reddish brown with a decent light biege head.  Aroma of fruit, yeast, caramel, and wood.  Taste is tart cherries, berries, yeast, malt, and wood.  Somewhat sour finish.  One of the best.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2014 small light beige head that disappears quite quick. brown-red clear beer. some hints of balsamico and vanilla in the aroma. slight sour, porto, feeble sweetness, complex oak. long full aftertaste.2008 edition / 75 cl @ kulminator / notes from backlog

2010 version: slight brown head, disappears fast. red-brown colour. aroma vinous, boozy, hint sweet, madeira/port, bretty. taste like aroma with wry note and dry finish. medium body and carbonation. same score as ^

2010 version, bought from Mikkeller and Friends.  Slightly chilled.  Dark brown colour, little head.  Smells strongly of cherry.  Despite the smell, there isnt as much cherry taste as in the normal Oerbier.  Sour fruit punch, clove and spice.  OK.

Bottled 330ml. -Courtesy of Marko, shared with him and heavy. Darker amber coloured, medium sized pale beige head, citric fruity and mild alcoholic nose. Sweet malty, fruity and yeasty with hint of wood and alcohol in the finish. Interesting but expected more.

2007 vintage , kulminator 
Pours dark red / brown . 
White/ brown foam 
Smells sweet / metalic 
Tastes metallic / sour / sweet . Not my thing , personaly

2010 edition, got in a trade with 77ships (thanks Eugene!). Poured a dark amber/brown/red body with a small off white head. The nose strikes you immediately, very vinuous, the barrel aging couldnt be more evident... quite funky too with notes of... saliva. Hmm. But somehow not in a bad way. Creamy mouthfeel, rosehip and plastic maltiness, with some light bitterness in the background, very weak floweriness. This is extremely well balanced. Superbly drinkable for 13% and yeah, a pretty great beer.
Smak och doft av torkad frukt, choklad, beligisk jäst , ekfat, vinös, brunt socker, karamell, toner av körsbär och vinäger. Riktigt bra balans mellan smakerna. Gott.

Bottle at Torst, 2004 vintage generously shared by jrgratz. Pours beautiful plummy amber with a medium white head. Aroma is sour funkiness, tart fruit and woody oak.  Taste is subtly tart with a faint sweetness but icnredibly smooth. This was a terrific beer. Thanks Justin!

Bottle, 2002 vintage from Torst, 03/23/2013. Jeppe told me this was aged in Chateauneuf du Pape barrels, somewhat different from the widely distributed version. Pours plum brown, ruby highlights, almost still, though a few bubbles ring the glass. Aroma is cherry, brandy soaked fruits, plum, darker caramel roast undertones, grapes and berries, oak. Taste is sweet candied fruit, licorice and anise, caramelized, de Dolle yeast character, nice funky red wine notes, tannic. Medium body, tongue tickling carbonation. Really beautifully aged, a real treat.

330 ml. bottle poured in to a trappist glass. 2010 vintage. Amber colour with a reddish hue. Thin, off-white head. Very complex and powerful aroma with oak, red berries, overripe fruits, yeasts, lactic, sourish, rich malts. The Bordeaux barrels aroma is so dominant, that this beer reminiscent of a Flemish Red. Excellent. Taste is complex and lightly sweet. Surprisingly light body for a 13% alc. Finishes bitter and long lasting sour with lots of barrel. What an excellent experience, another superb beer from De Dolle.
This review is exported from olutopas.info with no comment. Original rating date  22.10.2010
Bottle gift from SJ. Great as it warms Nice blend of sour, wood, fruit, and bread. Good balance of alcohol andsour notes.

This one poured a ruby red to light brown color, lightly murky, with a beige head.  Aroma was toffee, belgian yeast, light funk, dark fruits, and chocolate, wow.  Flavor was much the same, but just more intense, great amount of quad characteristics, but lighter, with some wood and light tartness. Really interesting stuff here.

33 cl bottle vintage 2008 @ home
Aroma is stale, somewhat sour and slightly tart with oaky notes, some cherries and vinegar. Flavour has woody notes, sour cherries and some spices. Also some wine‐like notes. Very tart finish with citron. A bit too much on the oud bruin side for my liking, but not bad anyway.
Had a bottle vintage 2009 in 07/2010, the most significant difference is that alcohol doesnt sting or disturb anymore, it is just of the warming type.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2016 330 ml bottle 2010 vintage @ toogoloog, Middelkerke, Belgian coast. Pours intense red brown with a very small head. Aroma of nuts, raisins, wine barrels and dark fruis. Full body with a tart sweetness immediately covered with massive yet noble sourness of the barrel. Taste of caramel, burgundy style wine and dates. Incredible
----
september 2013 bottling - aged for 3 years. Stunning how this develops so well. Much more complexity. Incredible.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2017 2009 bottle at home bought some time somewhere in Belgium. Red brown colour, small golden bubbly head. Aroma is fruity, dark, vinous, bit of brown sugar sweetness, maybe marzipan. Taste is nice. Pleasant sourness, no hint of the 13%. Wood, brown sugar again, maybe bit of cherry in the background. Nice fruitiness. Nice spritziness from the sourness. Really doesnt taste this strong! Lovely from de dolle as always.
Rerate, 2013 version. Great fruity aroma, bit sour. Great taste, vinous, woody, nice sourness, cant feel booze, so fruity, almonds at end.

Bottle dated 2002 from a Belgian friend in Brugge, Belgium. A dark amber/brown coloured pour with a medium off white head on top. Fruity, sour aroma. Tastes slightly sour/tart, fruity, apple, hint of caramel, slight sweetness. Probably seen better days IMO but still quite an interesting vintage.

Brown amber colour, white head. Quite sour aroma, wood, caramel, some funk. Light sour flavour, wood, malts, rather astringent. Finish astringent with quite a bit of wood.
The age shows through, but its nice to have been able to taste the oerbier reserva from its first year.
(From 33cL bottle @ The Vintage Tasting during Brugs Bier Festival. 2002 vintage. Courtesy of Filip. Thanks for sharing!)

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2016 Big reddish murky brown beauty. Small white head. The Aroma of a zing of tart funky notes, but as it warms these become more fruity and malty. Taste is big tartness but not too sour - balsamic vinegar vibe. As warms, sour tempers further and leads into some spicy malts. But sour always predominates. Palate remains a bitter sour.

06 from Vintage Estate, shared with Nate.  Pours red brown with lots of floaters, nice tan head, good lacing.  Nose is all lemon, sour lactic, vaporous.  Very, very sour with chocolate and ruite undertones, some odd, astringent bitter throughout the finish and after.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. 2010 brown bottle poured into a trappist glass.  Pours translucent medium brown with small off-white head.  Some thin lacing, medium body, medium carbonation, and dark fruit aroma.  Taste is dark fruit, oak, some wine notes, and some dark candy sugar.
Bottle. Murky red brown pour with an off white head. Big sour cherry, well balanced, alcohol extremely well hidden. Awesome beer.

Bottle shared by danbar. Thanks Dan.

The beer is pretty clear, and appears a light brown hue. The tan head is thin and wispy, fading rapidly after pouring. The aroma is definitely of a Flanders our bruin. Oak, sour cherries, malt, alcohol. The flavor is really enjoyable. Great balance and the subtle nuances are showcased well. Sour cherries, oak, and nary a trace of alcohol. Not sure where the 13% abv is hidden, but it is masked exceptionally well. Overall, a really tasty beer. Recommended.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 09-25-2011

Sur eddike/vinegar duft. Gullig skum men ikke vedvarende gardiner. Mudret med bobler. Smager meget surt og er snerpende i munden og kras i halsen. Surheden fortager sig så småt med tiden og de typiske belgian strong ale af rosiner og blommer kommer frem. Den har en eftersmag af sur glögg. Bestemt en spændende øl. Mere en sour ale end strong ale.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
This is an interesting beer, complex taste but a bit too sour. It would be worth trying again
Bottle/2010. Sour aroma, leather. Tickles the tongue. Sour and a funny swetness. Great beer. Very complex.
Sour aroma - warmer temperature more sweet, quite well balanced alcohol , sweet , dry, raisins and candy, sour ale or glögg?, quite complex, the warmer the better

2010 edition. Alcoholic, sour like vinegar, dry, powerful , complex with strong dried fruits and leather notes. Resembles more a sour ale than a strong ale. Highly recommendable beer. Dont serve it straight from the fridge..
Taste like a sour ale and very sour to begin with. Becomes better after a while and the taste of beeries and candy saves it.

Bottle at home. Vintage 2010. Pours a hazy deep wine red colour with a medium light beige. Allready on distance I sence the aroma with lots of oak. Theres also some leather, sour cranberries, forest, black currants, sauna and little bit alcohol. In addition in the flavour I find sweet cherries and hints of raspberries, and the ending is a bit dry. Has a very soft and rich mouthfeel, and a light berry bitterness. A beer full of great aroma and taste, and wheres is the touch of alcohol?! An absolute wonderful beer.
Bottle, pours a medium brown, aroma is a sour funk, flavour is also funk, its also got some dark fruits and a full body, a nice sweet finish and a really enjoyable beer

2009 bottle (cap actually says bottled in February of 2010.
Caramel, yet tart aroma. Very pleasing sour sweet taste. Alcohol is amazingly hidden. Ive been very impatiently waiting three years to drink this, ever since I bought it out of the brewmasters kitchen. At the time, their brewery was under repair from fire damage. Better than I remember. Highly recommended. Now I have to go back to Belgium.

2002 vintage. bottle from david paquet, shared also with minderbinder and tom10101. many thanks! murky medium dark brown-reddish with a small off-white rind. apples, spices, calvados, vinously oaked, caramel layered, raisins, lightly acidic, peppery, minty. soft carbonation, light to medium body - slightly thin, nice lightly acidic-citrusy and herbal finish. very nice!

Poured from bottle at armsby Abby.  Pours a beautiful dark red/purple with a solid off white head that is llasting even with the high alcohol content
Aroma is diverse, cherries tannin oak heavy fruit dominates.  Flavor is balanced but potent.  Slightly acidic with nice tart and sour flavors yet there is a pleasant fruity sweetness.  Easily one of the best oud bruins ive ever had

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2016 Bottle 330ml. [2002 vintage] Thx David.
Pours dirty, hazy brown, with no head to speak of. Aroma is of alcohol, bread, wine, wood, caramel, sugar, fruits. Taste is of alcohol, acidity, fruits, sweetness, warming alcohol, madeira, sligth oxidation, wood. Good body. Overall: A sipper. A bit old I would say, but still very good. A badass beer. Outstanding.[10/3/9/4/17]. Edit: 2007 vintage: Pours mahogany with low beige head. Aroma is of ketchup, fruits. Taste is of ketchup, cardboard, blood, fruits, slight acidity. Palate: Medium-full bodied. Soft carbonation. Overall: Good stuff. This aged well. [8/3/8/4/15]

Poured from a 2010 vintage bottle into a brandy snifter. Appearance is a dark, translucent brown with a nice beige head of foam. Had I realized the alcohol content, I probably would not have expected that. The aroma is very malty and leathery with some definitive tartness aspects to it. The taste is more of the malty sweetness, but it has a muted tartness to it that just makes the beer very interesting and fun to drink. It is a very good beer that manages to pull the alcohol content off without any effort. No burn at all.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2012 Bottle (330 ml) 2002. Huge thanks to David for sharing this beer! Hazy and thick dark amber with almost no head (as expected for a 10 years old beer) and some lacing. Aroma is incredibly complex with red wine, wood, apple, caramel, cherry and spices. Oxidation is barely perceptible. Taste is also really complex with wood, red wine, apple, caramel and spices. Theres an important acidic presence (a good one) that made this beer unique and its hiding the oxidation (which is still more perceptible in taste than in aroma). Mouthfeel is vinous, almost sirupy. Alcohol is warming, but when you realize the beer is 12% abv, you also realize that alcohol is pretty well hidden. This is really an amazing beer! Wonderfully complex and near perfect balance between acidity and big malty body. I would be curious to taste a younger version of this one. Merci David!

Bottle, 2010 vintage. Pours hazy deep reddish amber with a medium tan head, creamy with nice lacing. Aroma is tart cherry, wood, a bit of funk and molasses. Flavor starts medium sweet, followed by tartness, cherries, sweet tarts and more molasses. Finish is medium tart with plenty of warming alcohol, which has been perfectly hidden until this point. Complex and very interesting.
Sampled at an esbls tasting.  Hazedbrown wirh a beige head.  This is fruity and wild funky.  The taste is similar and is quite nice.  Complex .  I like it.

Poured into a tulip. Big thanks to SteveFinny for this. A 13% oud bruin, wtf?

4.5 A: Hazed deep plum color. Two fingers of frothy/pillowy beige head. Retention is very good, especially for the ABV and a big ring of lacing is left.

4.5 S: Huge cherry aroma. Tart and lightly acetic. Sweet, yet funky. Apple orchard, oak, vanilla, and berries. Im amazed at how well this is hiding the booze. That in itself is a feat. This is fairly simple for the style, but it smells so good that I cant deny it a stellar score.

4.5 T: Like this nose, this has a big intensity and the flavors mesh so well. Cherries and berries are the highlight. So much flavor that its like Im drinking a cherry cider or something. Moderate tartness and again, lightly acetic. Vanilla and oak next. The funk comes out to play offering rotting wood, apple orchard, wet grass, and some mustiness. The booze is more apparent in the taste, but its still well hidden. A bit of tannins from the barrel. Very good.

4.0 M: Medium body. Good moderate carbonation, which is lightly spritzy and a bit stingy. Not particularly creamy, but it works and works well.

4.0 D: Very tasty beer. I cant believe Im drinking an oud bruin this big. The flavors sure reflect that. Well done.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 08-14-2012 01:09:33

2009 vintage bottle at Eleven Madison Park NYC.  With final course and desert.  Dark ruby brown with tan head a good legs.  Aromas of must,tabacco, and burnt orange on a malty backbone.  Flavors is slightly sour and barely sweet.  Theres little hint of all that alcohol.  Body is dry and lightly tannic.  An really great rich beer suited for food.
Bottle. Hazy amber colour with large creamy off-white fully lasting head. Malty and hoppy aroma with yeasty notes. Very offfffff.

11.2oz bottle, 2010 vintage. Good khaki head. Very little bubbles on the side of the glass. Clear dark ruby color. Very nice tart taste, light sour. Pretty much no alcohol warmth or burn, astonishing. Maybe the slightest bite. Very light carbonation, surprisingly light body for the ABV. Clean dry finish. Aroma of vinous grapes, lemon juice, wood, light chocolate. Its very agreeable. Much like a wine, but easier to sip on, and tastier in my opinion. Hard to believe its 13%

Just as amazing as I could ask for..I had the oerbier the other day and it was amazing, this spec res is 13% but aged since 09. Its a little sour from the yeast but all in all it adds to the character. Its clean tan head sits nice, legs run easy, reddish dk brown color, aroma is sweet hay cardboard malt, and aging process adds to the brett aspect, I dont know how they did it compared to the norm oerbier, its phenominal but different. I like this one but the lambic/sour bier tone sets early and shines its really nice but the palate and taste are champions !

33cl bottle, 2010 vintage. Pours a cloudy, reddish-brown color with a big, off-white head. Aroma is oaky, sour, tart cherry.  Medium on the palate with average carbonation.  Flavor is sour, Oaky, earthy, a little booze heat, with a dry, earthy finish that lingers a while. Very tasty.

2010 bottle from Etre Gourmet webshop. Pours dark brown unclear with a big creamy off-white head. Aroma is sweet, bordeaux, and cherry. Taste is oak, sweet & sour, well balanced, light alcoholic burn at the end. High carbonated.
Lovely beer for a summer night.

2008 bottle at Bruces Housewarming Tasting. It pours cloudy deep brown, with a medium beige head. The nose is vinous, red grape, cherry, raspberry, wood, jammy, plum, almond and marzipan. The taste is berry, redcurrant, raspberry, vinous, red grape, jammy fruit and wood. Full body, fine carbonation and foamy mouth-feel. Delicious! Very fruity, jammy and downright flavoursome.

Bottle @ Bruces Housewarming Tasting. 2008 bottle. Deep hazy brownish red color with no head. The nose is of cherries and tart vinous fruits, A1 steak sauce. The taste is much the same - a pleasantly tangy oud bruin-style beer with nice accents of cherries and light wood. Sweet and slightly woody. Some grapes, jammy. Light body, active carbonation. Very nice.
Dark brown. Aroma is vinegar, caramel and dark fruits. Taste is somewhat similar with a sour finish.

Pours muddy dark brown with low off white head. Nice!
Aromas of raisins, roasted caramel malts, Almost a bit sour tones possibly from the bordeaux casks
Oh my good what a beer! Perfect mix between strong ale and lambic! Creamy sweet full bodied, alcohol warmth, ending in a nice long sweet n sour oak casky finish. This is very very good!

Bottle. Pours rich semi clear orange/brown with off white lacing. Aroma of dark fruits, cherries, plums, some pear cider, red wine, acetone-like alcohol. Flavour as above with lots of cherry. Medium to full bodied, fruity, dry. My glass tasted different to those I shared it with.

29th October 2009Kulminator on the Borefts 1 trip. 2008 Vintage. Cloudy brown beer, good cream coloured head. Sour caramel. Minerally marmite. Creamy and tangy. Bitterish aftertaste. A 2006 bottle smelled dusty and tasted dusty. Poor.

ours a rusty ruby red with a beige head with not head retention. The nose starts with a sweet cinnamon an then a big stinky camembert cheese with a hints of  a barnyard/horse blanket smell. After it is followed by cherries and green apples. The noses finishes with a apple cider smell. Wow, shes got a bit of funk in her. The pallets starts with hints of sour cherries with bursts of green apple. Th middle has leather and oak. The finishes is long and complex with a bits of bitterness and a little astringent. Over all a delicious beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 11.2 oz bottle into a tulip.

This is an aggressively carbonated beer.  A large, off-white sea foam froth forms over a caramel amber beer.  

The nose is tart, with nice cherry notes.  There is some oak, vanilla, and vinegar in the back.

The flavor mostly follows the nose.  It is simple, but nice.  Tart cherries, 

The mouthfeel is really fizzy and bubbly.  Even without a full body, it held the 13% ABV really nicely.  It was tart and slightly acetic, but not incredibly sour.  

This is a nice Flemish sour.
UPDATED: DEC 10, 2012 Birra miracolosa, vero e proprio elisir belga. Praticamente perfetta, non cè altro da dire!!!!!
Vintage 08. Brown with a tan head. Aroma is caramel, redwine, balsamic vinegar and dried red berries. Flavour is caramel, balsamic vinegar, alcohol and dried red berries.

Vintage 08. Pours a clear and ruby beer with a weak offwhite head. The aroma is malt, sweetness, fruit, dried fruit, balsamic and alcohol. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is dry with sweetness and alcoholwarmth. Overall a really good beer.

Medium body and intense aroma. Intensely sour finish but not altogether unpleasant. Might taste a bit of sour cherries in this. Im not typically a fan of sour beers, but this one is undeniably well done.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2013 Bottle brought to Qbrick by KyotoLefty. Thanks! Very sharp sherry or port wine aromas with lots of dark fruit. Sourish flavors of overipe cherries, prunes, raisins. Good carbonation (for its age). Thin body. Long sour aftertaste, gentle and sustained. Just the tiniest touch of oxidation, which actually adds to the flavor experience. Exceptional stuff!

Note: March 15, 2013. Had 2009 vintage. Also wonderful. Rated almost identically. 8/3/9/3/18 = 4.2

2005 bottle. Nose of big dried fruits, wine or port, a bit of soy sauce. Very fruity flavor, grapes and cherries, some nice sour tang but in control, oak. Very low oxidation and still well carbonatedin fact, in simply wonderful condition. Great body. A fabulous beer that lived up to high expectations.

2007 bottle. Pours tawny brown with a trace of off-white head which quickly dissipates. Aroma is caramel and cookie malt, sour fruit, grassy hops, and oak barrels. Flavor is balanced malt, hops, and sour fruit esters; dry finish. Medium body, carbonation, and warmth.

This is one of the best things I have ever put in my mouth.  Its been  awhile but I had quite a few 2006 vintages. Around 13% alcohol and very hard to detect even the slightest warmth. Beautiful sour notes and complex flavors make this big beer hard to sip.
Bottle, 2005, 2008, 2009, 2010 vintages. Murky brown pour. Fruity, dark and dried (cherry, plum, raisin), vanilla, wood. Active body, sweet and sour.
Rödbrun grumlig öl med mycket lite smutsvitt skumm. Doft av omogna äpplen, torr cider, vinöst. Fruktig smak med surhet, drag i kinderna, körsbär och kryddighet. Mycket komplex.
At the sour tasting, Part B, thanks beerandbeyond, Pours cloudy brown. Smells muddy, then alcoholic and then cherry. Tastes sour, hot and acidic. Fizzy body.
